Name: IS 237
overview: I.S. 237 provides a robust and supportive middle school experience and, at the same time, promotes college and career readiness in multiple ways. Our strong academic program includes Special Progress (SP) courses on each grade level. Eighth grade SP students take Regents exams in Algebra, US History & Government, Earth Science, and Living Environment, as well as the Spanish Proficiency exam. Many students go on to attend Stuyvesant, Bronx Science, and Brooklyn Tech. English language learners receive instruction before, after, and during the school day as well as on Saturdays. All students receive instruction in visual arts, band, strings, or chorus. Our extended day programs include academic tutoring, basketball, musical theater, guitar, keyboard, and art. Our Debate and Math teams have won multiple district-, borough-, and city-wide tournaments. SONYC, a free after-school program, offers homework help and recreational activities Monday through Friday from 2:20pm-5pm, Monday and Wednesday evenings from 5pm-6:30pm, and is open during most school holidays. We welcome parent involvement at all times.

Name: PS 164 QUEENS VALLEY
overview: A dedicated staff and small school environment offer individualized social, emotional, and academic support. Queens Valley School offers all students high quality, differentiated instruction to prepare them for high school as well as college and/or a career. We value our technology program which includes SMART Boards, computers, and a state of the art lab. We offer an accelerated Regents program to all eligible eighth grade students. Our web-based programs include Castle Learning, Ed Performance, GoMath, Code X, Flocabulary, and MyOn Reading. Our Talent program provides students with an innovative and in-depth study in visual arts, dance, drama, vocal music, and video production. In addition, we have added a Talent track in coding and publishing; this provides our students with an opportunity to develop skills in STEM, computer programming, and graphic design. It is a vibrant program that strives to encourage and facilitate an enriched and creative environment. Our teachers model their artistic process with commitment to scaffold instruction. We have had students place as both finalists and semifinalists in the P.S. Art city-wide competition since its inception 10 years ago.

Name: PS 200 POMONOK
printedschoolname: The Magnet School of Global Studies & Leadership (P.S./M.S. 200)
overview: We are now The Magnet School of Global Studies & Leadership. Our students study nations and cultures from around the world and they explore ways in which they can become leaders and effect global change. In class, students have daily access to laptops and iPads to support their learning. Our curriculum emphasizes the use of STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) education to make the world a better place. We are a unique school because we are small, but we span grades PK-8. Middle school students engage in challenging lessons with each other each day, but they also act as mentors for younger students in the building. Our motto is: "200 Cares." We strive to build and maintain a caring school environment where all students feel welcome and supported. Middle school students engage in two semesters of enrichment electives each year, including topics like chess, media studies, yoga, comedic improvisation, journalism, community service, and sign language. In addition to the core academic subjects, we offer Spanish, Visual Arts, Drama, and Physical Education three times per week. We also invite middle school students to participate in sports and dance before school and to attend our free, daily after-school program.

Name: PS 219 PAUL KLAPPER
overview: We are proud of our school. Teachers, students, and families are dedicated. We practice the concept of social justice which we translate to mean Equity Access, maximum inclusion for all. This is reflected in how we build our classes, organize all activities, and ensure that every student has access to all the school has to offer. Nearly all of our students take two Regents and our high passing rate reflects high expectations and high achievement for all students. The process starts for many of our students in pre-K and we welcome new students all along the way to eighth grade graduation! Parents appreciate how our school provides a challenging curriculum within a small learning community that promotes positive behavior. Our collaborative teams work together to set goals, to plan for effective instruction, and to monitor and assess student performance. The skills and strategies that students gain enable them to attain success and reach their potential. Our skilled staff supports families in many ways. Parents feel that the school creates a physically and emotionally secure environment in which everyone can focus on student learning. A quick visit to the school will reveal the family feel most visitors notice when they are here.

Name: PS 178 HOLLISWOOD
overview: All children can exceed standards by being part of a nurturing environment that challenges them to reach their full potential. At P.S./I.S. 178, we promote an environment that encourages open communication, and where every community member is a participant in contributing to the school's success. We create a haven where students are empowered and recognized for their unique abilities. At our school, there is a strong commitment to teamwork and collaboration. Staff members, parents, guardians, and students find the family environment which they are a part of to be remarkable. Differentiated instruction and acceleration take place from pre-kindergarten through eighth grade classes daily. After school, there is a plethora of programs to choose from. We are proponents of enrichment and arts programs, as well as sports. We believe that every student is an expert at something and it is our shared responsibility as educators to identify what that is and to tap into that knowledge to develop other skills.

Name: JHS 216 GEORGE J RYAN
overview: We have a diverse community and a student-centered environment promoting mutual respect for all and maximizing students' potential for high school readiness. Chosen as one of only 11 Chancellor's Learning Partners Plus Schools, we received praise for being in the top 1% of NYC middle schools for student progress in 2015 and again in 2017. We received "Well-Developed" in all 10 categories on the 2015 Quality Review. Teachers address the Common Core Learning Standards in all subject areas and produce exceptional lessons through thematic interdisciplinary learning/teaching. Ryan has three academies (Law & Justice, Media Arts, and Scientific Exploration) that offer the same rich Common Core curriculum with opportunities for additional learning based on academy theme. Each academy offers Honors/SP courses, talent courses, and classrooms infusing technology. Incoming sixth graders all take robotics and art talent courses. We are one of only two schools in NYC offering a full year of Robotics instruction for every sixth grader. We are a Software Engineering Program school offering computer programming/coding. Our school also benefits from a partnership with St. John's University. We believe in helping great children become great students.

Name: JHS 217 ROBERT A VAN WYCK
overview: Students like our technology-based education. They use their laptops in class to take notes via the use of Google Docs, do research, and create iMovies, PowerPoints, class wikis, and class blogs. Through our Green Magnet Educating for Sustainability curriculum, students are involved in studying about, and taking actions in, their local and global communities. Students also like the wide range of in-class programs and after-school activities we offer. Parents appreciate our parent education classes and the school's communication efforts, including many opportunities for parental involvement. We utilize a web-based communication portal called PupilPath that permits parents and students to track student academic and behavior progress daily and in real-time. Laptops and additional digital devices are utilized in all classrooms. Our school community is diverse, with over 40 nations represented. We have a greenhouse, pollinators' garden, and an organic vegetable garden on our campus.

Name: YOUNG WOMEN'S LEADERSHIP SCHOOL QUEENS
printedschoolname: The Young Women's Leadership School, Queens
overview: The Young Women's Leadership School (TYWLS), Queens is structured to give each young woman individualized attention. We focus on nurturing the academic, social, and developmental growth of our students. We expect our students to go above and beyond the New York City and New York State school graduation requirements as we prepare them for college. Our parents appreciate the personalized attention their family receives. We use PupilPath, a web-based communication system, to inform our parents of their daughter's academic progress. Parents also appreciate the Summer Bridge Enrichment Program for incoming sixth grade students. The Young Women's Leadership Network (YWLN) and the CollegeBound Initiative provide a full-time CollegeBound counselor. Students are immediately exposed to colleges, college fairs, and expectations beginning in sixth grade.

Name: JHS 210 ELIZABETH BLACKWELL
overview: Elizabeth Blackwell Middle School 210Q believes that all students in our programs can achieve high standards of excellence within academic areas. We always emphasize the role of both the school and the home in ensuring that our children grow cognitively, creatively, and socially. Our message is to engage all of our students in our programs in active and productive activities. At MS210 we have high expectations for ALL our students. Our core values of creativity, perseverance, citizenship, courage, integrity, responsibility, self-discipline, and teamwork will guide how we interact socially and academically at MS210. We have a Career Academy theme. There are five different career academies: Academy of Graphic Arts and Computer Science, Academy of Visual and Performing Arts, Academy of Health Professions, Academy of Law and Humanities, and Academy of Engineering and Architecture. Within the AGACS, students learn graphic arts and computer technology; within AVPA they learn studio art, theatre, instrumental band, and vocal music; within AHP they learn forensic science and introduction to health professions; within ALH they learn philosophy, criminal justice, and urban law; and within AEA they learn design and modeling and robotics.

Name: MS 137 AMERICA'S SCHL OF HEROES
overview: America's School of Heroes is a large, diverse, urban middle school in Ozone Park, Queens. It is made up of professionals dedicated to providing every student with the support to grow emotionally, intellectually, and socially into a contributing member of society. We are committed to instilling the importance of education and lifelong learning, as well as college and career readiness. M.S. 137 provides its staff with professional learning that supports continued growth and best practices that promote student progress. We offer specialized classes, Regents classes, and academic intervention support services. Our media library is filled with resources, and our librarian collaborates with students and staff on a variety of projects and initiatives. We continue to refine our curriculum to meet the goals of the Common Core Learning Standards. We recognize the importance of collaboration between all members of our school community. Through these endeavors, we prepare our students for high school and college- and career-readiness.

Name: JHS 202 ROBERT H GODDARD
overview: Robert H. Goddard 202 is a diverse NYC middle school. Our mission is to provide our students with a comprehensive education with an emphasis on the Fine Arts. Our strong arts program provides instrumental and choral music, visual arts, and drama. Each arts program is highlighted throughout the year with performance and gallery presentations. Our students have participated in honors festivals and Carnegie Hall performances. We infuse technology to teach to the 21st century learner. Our teachers are regularly trained in new innovative teaching methods that will meet the needs of our varied student population. Every classroom is equipped with interactive white boards as well as various forms of technology. We offer advanced regents courses in algebra and earth science as well as classes for students with disabilities and English language learners. We strive for 100% literacy with our partnership with MSQI.

Name: JHS 226 VIRGIL I GRISSOM
overview: J.H.S. 226 focuses on exploratory learning. The school is organized into four learning communities. The Discovery and Explorations Academy is a hub for sixth graders, which allows students opportunities to explore the Junior High School experience through academic rigor, discipline, creativity, and culture. The Humanities Academy for Performing Arts showcases the talent in our youngsters with quarterly displays in music, art, dance, poetry, and drama. Visionaries Academy for Science and Technology engages students in developing projects in web design, air and space exploration, PowerPoint, and DNA splicing. The Renaissance Academy for Broadcast Journalism engages students in print and digital media. Students utilize elements of print and digital media to develop quarterly displays in a student newspaper, video broadcast, and a student comic magazine, while continuing to engage in academic rigor around the Common Core Learning Standards.

Name: I S 025 ADRIEN BLOCK
overview: Adrien Block I.S. 25 offers a variety of classes for a diverse group of learners. All classes follow the Common Core and engage students in rigorous learning, preparing them for high school and beyond. I.S. 25 immerses our students in a college- and career-readiness program. The Performing Arts Program is an integral part of our school culture. Students have the opportunity to choose from Band, Chorus, Dance, Art, and Keyboard in grade six and develop their talent during their time at I.S. 25. We offer a School Enrichment Model (SEM) which provides enriched learning experiences where students engage in learning clusters based on their strengths and interests. Some clusters include: Computer Programming, Drama, Fashion Blogger, Stock Market, Sports Marketing, and Manga Anime. We partner with Greater Ridgewood Youth Council five days a week, 2:30pm-5:30pm. Activities include homework support, basketball, archery, art programs, community building, and STEM.

Name: JHS 067 LOUIS PASTEUR
overview: Louis Pasteur Middle School 67Q is dedicated to promoting academic achievement by creating a supportive teaching and learning environment that recognizes the unique social, emotional, and intellectual needs of young adolescents. Since 1991, we have embraced the tenets of a middle school philosophy. We remain committed to providing an excellent, well-rounded education within a nurturing environment. We also are proud of the devotion and support each child can expect from our entire staff. Students have opportunities to join clubs, teams, and activities enabling them to demonstrate their talents and follow their interests. Our Student Organization sponsors community service projects and family events at Broadway shows and local sporting events. Also, our students excel in the Arts and perform for the school and surrounding community through a Drama production and a "Night of the Arts."

Name: JHS 074 NATHANIEL HAWTHORNE
overview: Nathaniel Hawthorne Middle School provides a nurturing environment where students from grades six through eight are empowered to explore their passions, through facilitated learning opportunities that lead to student achievement. We acknowledge that, as individuals, we all have different needs and aspirations. We collaborate with our families to ensure that a complete education is provided in order to prepare our students for high school, college, and beyond. As a "Respect for All" school, this mission is built into the fabric of our school culture and climate. We are proud to partner with the NYCDOE Urban Advantage Science Initiative, Office of Arts and Special Projects through Arts Achieve, St. Francis College, and the Jose Limon Dance Company to provide rigorous field experiences and differentiated learning opportunities that help to intellectually challenge our students. We believe that Together Everyone Achieves More, which is what makes this school a shining jewel within the community.

Name: JHS 158 MARIE CURIE
overview: We provide challenging instruction in a nurturing environment. Our teachers address the Common Core Learning Standards (CCLS) by infusing technology into our curriculum so that students achieve their potential and are ready to enter college. We have a state-of-the-art computer lab and each class has access to SMART Boards and iPads. Students have opportunities to showcase their literary and artistic talents. We use SchoolMessenger, email, and an online grading system to keep parents informed of their child's progress. We offer after-school programs daily through our partnership with the Samuel Field Y Beacon Program. Through our partnerships, students are provided experiences and enrichment to develop their learning. Our Technology and Fine Arts Department receives many grants. Per an average compiled by the Wall Street Journal, M.S. 158 sends more students to Specialized High Schools than any other middle school in Queens.

Name: JHS 008 RICHARD S GROSSLEY
overview: All students are encouraged to participate in school activities and community service as well as to develop meaningful relationships with adults in our school. Students enjoy the availability of interesting classes and after-school activities. There is an enrichment program to fit each student’s needs. Parents appreciate our various methods of making the home/school connection. We communicate with parents using the school messenger system which notifies parents of school events over the telephone, emails, and mailings. In addition, we provide informational workshops for parents. Parents also enjoy our new Parent Center which is complete with computers, a color printer, and comfortable seating. Our parent coordinator and community assistants are available to demonstrate Skedula, Acuity, and Access web-based programs for families. Parents/Guardians also like our principal’s open door policy, where they have an opportunity to meet with the principal, academy principals, and school staff.

Name: JHS 072 CATH. & COUNT BASIE
overview: Our school is a community of instructional innovation that provides choices and options for young people to become critical thinkers and lifelong learners in an environment of care and respect. Our goal is to meet the need of every young person through collaboration, opportunity, and experience. Catherine and Count Basie Middle School is one of the best-kept secrets of District 28. Our school staff is committed to providing a high-quality and meaningful educational experience for each child. The school's environment supports students, parents, and staff in an effort to offer every child an opportunity for an excellent education. Our curriculum includes specialty courses, advisory courses, elective courses, and a range of extracurriculars, all within a challenging curriculum. We provide students with the opportunity to take educational excursions, visit colleges and universities, interact with political officials, and use their voices to impact change in our ever-changing society.

Name: I S 059 SPRINGFIELD GARDENS
overview: I.S. 59 prepares all students to read, write, compute, speak well, and behave in socially acceptable ways in order to become independent members of society. The students participate in enrichment programs such as Project-Based Learning, Regents classes in math and science, Project Arts (performing arts academic connection), and an after-school and Summer program with the YMCA. Many of our parents are active participants in our school community throughout the school day and in Adult-Learning Computer Classes. We use TeacherEase, a web-based communication system to inform our parents of their child's successes. Our students have the highest acceptance rate in the NYC area for the Legal Outreach Program. Selected eighth grade students participate in the school's partnership with Northwell-LIJ for extended science instruction. In September 2013, we implemented a new academy for gifted students, The Rising Star Academy for Scholars, and a new state-of-the-art multi-purpose playground.

Name: PS 116 WILLIAM C. HUGHLEY
overview: We believe in providing a nurturing learning environment where students benefit from an academically rigorous curriculum rich in the arts, science, and social studies, as well as ELA and math. Students are presented with clear objectives for learning, rigorous tasks, and opportunities to engage in accountable talk on a daily basis. We build our students' character by infusing service learning into our lessons. They will participate in school and community projects that are meaningful. By laying a foundation across content areas and infusing the arts and character-building into the curriculum, our goal is to prepare every scholar at our school to enter and graduate from a four-year college or university. We are truly committed to the following: student responsibility, teacher accountability, academic achievement, nurturing environment, dedication to strengthening the home-school connection, aspiring to succeed, respect for all, development of community relations, and social awareness.

Name: IS 192 THE LINDEN
overview: The Linden-Renaissance Middle School (I.S. 192 The Linden) offers a variety of learning opportunities through a STEM focus. We are the designated District STEM School, and the leading technology school in the district for the last five years. We are the only district school to offer a Robotics Program, and have a current Championship Team. We teach 21st century skills using 21st century tools such as: Apple iPads, the Apple Mac Lab, and interactive whiteboards throughout classrooms. In addition, our newest additions include a state of the art recording studio, fitness center, and our dance studio. We offer an Early High School Program where our students have the opportunity to acquire high school and Regents credits by the end of eighth grade. In addition to our various academic focuses, we also offer a variety of both competitive, and non-competitive athletic programs. We offer extensive after-school and Saturday programs. Our parents participate in a variety of programs and activities throughout the year.

overview: I.S. 238 "The Susan B. Anthony Academy" offers students of all abilities and learning styles the opportunity to succeed in a climate of respect for all members of the school community. All eighth-grade students take Integrated Algebra I Regents and Living Environment Regents. We are part of the Middle School Quality Initiative (MSQI) and the Art as Text Partnership through Lincoln Center. Our teachers frequently attend professional development sessions focused on student engagement and collaboration. Over 50 classrooms have interactive SMART Board technology, Promethean Flat Panel Systems, and we also have SMART Board Presentation Systems, wireless computer carts, and iPad carts. Additionally, we have an Apple iMac lab, graphic arts courses, chorus courses, and dance courses. We value our students and make their educational needs our priority.

printedschoolname: Pathways College Preparatory School: An Early College School
overview: Pathways College Preparatory School (PCPS) is a community that educates the mind, body, and soul of each of our students in preparation for entrance into and success in college. We view college opportunity and success as a pathway to excellence and equity in life. Through our partnerships with families, community organizations, and universities, we seek out real-world learning experiences for students to enhance their skills and knowledge. As a result, graduates from PCPS will be able to use their experiences to think critically about personal, political, and professional responsibility and the impact of their choices on their lives, community, and the world at large.

Name: P.S. 268
overview: P.S./I.S. 268 exemplifies a respectful, cooperative, and nurturing environment. Our mission is to create self-motivated, caring, and successful citizens by fostering independence and resourcefulness. Learners achieve academic success by collaborating, sharing values, displaying a zest for increasing their knowledge, and showing integrity and respect. Our school is a NYC Blueprint for the Arts model school. We offer comprehensive programs in art, dance, and music in all grades. Students in grade six are exposed to each art form. In grades seven and eight, students have an opportunity to focus in one of the arts. This allows students to develop their talent, build their portfolio, and prepare for auditions. We are partnered with Urban Advantage and engage student in STEAM activities in our state of the art science lab. We collaborate with several cultural institutions which support our teachers, students, and families in preparing for future careers. The school also boasts a state-of-the-art library as well as SMART Boards in every classroom. We offer support for students who are aspiring to gain high school credits and/or attend specialized high schools. Over 90% of our students pass the New York State Common Core Algebra Regents.

Name: IRWIN ALTMAN MIDDLE SCHOOL 172
overview: Irwin Altman M.S. 172 combines cutting-edge technology, a dedicated and experienced staff, and a student-oriented philosophy to achieve our goal of academic excellence for all of our students. We are acutely aware of our students' unique social and emotional needs as they transition from their elementary schools into the more challenging rigors of preparing for college and career readiness in the sixth, seventh, and eighth grades. We believe that students learn best by authentic and rigorous intellectual engagement aligned to the Common Core Learning Standards. Emphasis is placed on in-depth academic exploration that results in high quality discussion and writing that demonstrates deep and elaborate thinking in all content areas. Additionally, M.S. 172 was noted in the NYCDOE Annual Arts Report for our dedication to Arts Education including visual, and performance arts. At M.S. 172, we provide parents with ongoing contact and school information through our school website, MS172.org and Skedula/PupilPath, emails, and phone messages. In collaboration with our PTA, we promote parent engagement through informational, and both child and parent-centered activities that fulfill our mission of being the educational center of our community.

Name: P.S./I.S. 266
overview: Located on the 32-acre Frank Padavan Campus, P.S./I.S. 266 is a barrier-free building that offers a Common Core standards-based curriculum in all content areas. Students thrive in a nurturing setting where they build a strong personal connection that facilitates student achievement while meeting their emotional and social needs. The cornerstones of this atmosphere are rooted in developing: a community of learners where students, parents, and staff seek to expand their knowledge; building leadership capacity where all constituencies develop ownership of the school's mission, vision, and educational process; a collegial environment that emphasizes the learning process through sharing of knowledge, strategies, and methodologies; a school of philosophers where pertinent questions are asked ensuring vitality and growth. Our academic environment is one of great rigor, offering a range of honors courses in grades seven and eight, and a variety of special programs including Chess Club, CHAMPS, Real Heroes program, Youth Alive, Legion of Leaders, Debate Team, Tri-M, Drama Club Grades 6-8, Extravaganza Grades K-5, and Festival Choir Grades 5-8.

Name: JEAN NUZZI INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL
overview: Jean Nuzzi Intermediate School 109 provides an accessible, high-quality, and future-oriented education as well as community service through a variety of academically rigorous classes. We serve the diverse needs of all learners in the ever-changing local, regional, and global economy. In an atmosphere of free inquiry and technological innovation, we deliver quality instruction, programs, and activities that give students transferable education and skills, as well as personal social enrichment. When students graduate from Jean Nuzzi Intermediate School 109, they will have had enriching experiences that encourage lifelong learning.

Name: PS 147 RONALD MCNAIR
overview: We understand the responsibility to prepare our students to meet and exceed the challenges and opportunities of a globally connected technological society. We are committed to providing a rigorous academic program within an environment that offers each student learning experiences that will enable them to meet or exceed state performance standards and grow into independent critical thinkers. To further our technological goals and develop a stronger student-centered approach, our school is now a member of the iLearn NYC community and we will offer blended learning and online courses to our middle school students. Parents also appreciate the social work we do with students, including providing rich student activity/service club experiences. A student stated, "I like P.S. 147, they don't give up on you." We want all students and parents to feel that we will not give up on them.

Name: P.S./I.S. 208
overview: The mission of P.S./I.S. 208 is to prepare the leaders of tomorrow by building a safe, nested community of learners where every participant is fully engaged in document-based questions, accountable talk, scientific and inquiry-based research strategies, and performance-oriented tasks, as well as creating a nurturing learning environment via sound instructional practices and differentiated learning. Additionally, we will empower children to become self-sufficient and responsible. At P.S./I.S. 208, we create lifelong learners and children who are proficient in science and the arts.

Name: PS 042 R VERNAM
overview: P.S./M.S. 42 achieves academic excellence for all students by supporting their strengths and needs. Our goal is to meet the Common Core Learning Standards while creating a learning environment that will boost all students to grade level and above. We build morale by instilling in our students, staff, and parents a sense of self-respect along with an appreciation for the diversity of the multicultural society in which we live, work, and learn. As a school community, we believe that students learn best through instruction that is tailored to their specific learning styles and needs. We have invested in technology to advance the skills of our students and make them competitive in today's world. All of our classrooms are equipped with SMART Boards, and over 250 laptops and 140 iPad minis are available for students within classrooms. We provide parents with up-to-date information so that they can partner with the school to ensure that every child is college- and career-ready.

Name: PS 047 CHRIS GALAS
overview: Our school's vision is one in which the staff members, students, and parents work collaboratively in a safe and supportive environment. Learning is defined as an ongoing process that is incorporated into all aspects of the curriculum, as well as enrichment programs that link the arts and literacy. We strongly encourage our students to take risks within the safety of the classroom in order to facilitate independence and higher-order thinking skills. Our students will evolve into responsible, accountable, and self-assured adults who will establish themselves as part of the community network. Having only one class per grade level allows students to receive a lot of individual attention from our strong staff. Our middle school curriculum consists of the core subjects of humanities (ELA and social studies), math, and science. We are a Respect for All award school.

Name: I S 053 BRIAN PICCOLO
overview: M.S. 53 is a community school that is dedicated to providing a well-rounded education to our students. From our community BBQs to our neighborhood food and clothing drives and celebrations that include our students showcasing the arts and their academics, we strive to give back to our community. Parents appreciate our open-door policy and our welcoming environment, which includes a family room in our Parent Coordinator's office. Our M.S. 53 staff works collaboratively with our active Parents Association (PA) to plan and implement various family engagement activities throughout the school year. Our parents are also active members in the School Leadership Team (SLT) meetings. Students enjoy the numerous in-school and after-school programs available through our partnership with Sports and Arts in School Foundation (SASF), designed to enrich their learning experience. We are also a Broadway Junior school—our students participate in their own rendition of a Broadway Play, and get to see the same play on Broadway. Students also benefit from our annual All Boys Forum and All Girls Forum where we host guest speakers and engage in meaningful activities tailored to the unique needs of our students at the middle school level.

Our positive attitude fosters a climate that motivates both staff and students to perform with enthusiasm! Each day, our students are engaged in learning the Common Core Standards as we prepare them to be college- and career-ready. Our staff and administration work hard to bridge the gap between school, family, and community through field trips, school events, and parent workshops.

Name: PS 114 BELLE HARBOR
overview: P.S./M.S. 114 is a K-8 neighborhood school in the Belle Harbor section of Queens. We provide a nurturing environment in a familiar setting for our middle school students. Eighth grade students are offered the opportunity to graduate with Regents credits in Living Environment and Algebra. In addition, our students are able to partake in the following extra-curricular activities before, during, and after school: National Junior Honors Society, foreign language (Spanish), concert/marching/jazz bands, journalism club, art club, technology club and squad, dances, curriculum-related trips, senior trip, Millennium after-school program, and the CHAMPS sports program.

Name: CHANNEL VIEW SCHOOL FOR RESEARCH
overview: Channel View School for Research (CVSR) is an Expeditionary Learning School that believes students learn best through a project-based approach. Students focus on character and career development by participating in small advisory groups called Crew. Our students are researchers, historians, urban planners, and scientists that investigate real world problems and develop creative, actionable solutions using cutting-edge technology. Our Oceanography/Robotics program uses drone technology that allows students to actively explore the aquatic ecology beneath Jamaica Bay and the Atlantic Ocean. Our program is highly engaging and pushes students to do their best while developing a culture of collaboration and teamwork.

Name: THE SCHOLARS ACADEMY
overview: Scholars' Academy is a 6-12th grade school with a competitive school-based application process. Parents/students must apply for admission in November-December online via the school's website. A highly rigorous school, Scholars' Academy earned "Well Developed" ratings on the Quality Review and "Excellent Ratings" on the School Quality Snapshot in every category: Rigorous Instruction, Collaborative Teachers, Supportive Environment, Effective School Leadership, Strong Family-Community Ties, and Trust. Scholars' Academy is an Innovation Zone Ambassador School. Scholars' Academy teachers and students collaborate using online tools to engage in projects which are Common Core-anchored and engaging. Scholars' Academy follows the Scale-Up cooperative learning model used by many top universities such as MIT. All students are expected to complete three high school Regents courses in middle school. The primary career- and college-readiness partner of the Scholars' Academy is Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. Broadridge executives provide career awareness training, on-site shadowing opportunities, mentoring, college essay support, and scholarships to select Scholars' Academy High School students. Friday dismissal is 1:12pm.

In addition, they have the opportunity to learn to read music and play an instrument, as well as to participate in chorus and performing arts-related activities. Parents and guardians appreciate the instructional, cultural, and motivational programs that are the centerpieces of our students' middle school experiences and which also provide many leadership development opportunities.

Name: PS 029 MELROSE SCHOOL
overview: At the Melrose School, students are encouraged to reach towards challenging goals. We take pride in offering a world-class education and educational opportunities to our students. Technological resources such as computers, laptops, and interactive white boards in all classrooms are integral in the delivery of instruction and the development of students' skills. Through extracurricular opportunities, students' horizons are further broadened by trips to academic and cultural institutions and sporting events. At the Melrose School, parents value our sense of community, commitment, and collaboration. Our students wear uniforms and we incentivize positive behaviors through the Positive Behavior Intervention and Supports (PBIS) program. Our ultimate goal is to see our students enter the best high schools in New York City that are extensions of the experiences they were afforded at P.S./M.S. 29.

overview: We maintain a cohesive school community of families, teachers, and staff who support our core mission. Our students learn to think critically, communicate effectively, and to be open to new experiences and ideas as they become lifelong learners. The mission of South Bronx Preparatory is to facilitate learning so that all students can master a strong academic foundation. The South Bronx Preparatory community guides each student toward college readiness, higher education, and independence beginning in the sixth grade. We are a 6-12 secondary school.

Name: MS 223/THE LABORATORY SCHOOL OF FINANCE AND TECH
printedschoolname: The Laboratory School of Finance and Technology: X223
overview: Students get excited for our technology program, featuring three computer labs, SMART Boards in all classrooms, trips to Google and New York's Silicon Alley, and a MOUSE Squad. All of our middle school students take computer science, allowing students to learn coding, robotics, web design, and many other programs. Parents love our innovative technology and finance programs where students are immersed in a schoolwide economy with School Bucks, financial courses, school jobs, a school bank, and a school store. The school has been featured in The New York Times, PBS, New York Daily News, Wall Street Journal, NY1 News, and the NY Post for its innovative programs. M.S. 223 is featured in Clara Hemphill's book New York City's Best Public Middle Schools: A Parents' Guide. All middle school students receive expanded day programming including academic support, arts, and athletics. We have a strong Spanish dual language program and most students remain in our high school program. Middle school students engage in educational trips and college visits in New York City and beyond including Philadelphia, Boston, and Washington, DC. We have something exciting for everyone!

Name: P.S./I.S. 224
printedschoolname: Science School for Exploration and Discovery (M.S. 224)
overview: At M.S. 224, collaboration is vital to the success of the school. Family outreach is fully integrated into our teachers' schedules. Our parent coordinator also holds monthly workshops that vary from informational to recreational. The School Leadership Team and our online grading system, PupilPath keep our parents well-informed. Our guidance team t work to strengthen the bond with our community through special events for students and families. We expect our students to become caring, respectful, productive, and informed members of society as they move through their middle school careers. M.S. 224 has created an exceptional learning environment due to a dedicated faculty, hardworking students, and a supportive parent association. The rigorous curriculum focuses on integrating skills across humanities, math, science, art, music, and technology. There are opportunities for students to participate in the 21st Century After-School Program: cooking, visual arts, coding, dance, theater, drumming, and boys and girls mentoring. Weil Law Firm provides college and career readiness to our mentees. Students participate in the Mock Trial Competition, Underwater Robotics, and the Guppy Tank App Challenge-which we won in 2016.

Name: SOUTH BRONX ACADEMY FOR APPLIED MEDIA
printedschoolname: South Bronx Academy for Applied Media
overview: Students value that South Bronx Academy for Applied Media (SBAAM) provides many learning opportunities to prepare them for higher education, careers, and life. SBAAM provides a small, nurturing, and disciplined environment in which adults and children are meaningfully engaged in learning. Parents/guardians appreciate our emphasis on the success of the whole child, including students' academic and social development. Parents are given the opportunity to collaborate with staff to plan a variety of special events for the benefit of our students. We also provide an extended-learning time for our students to receive additional academic support and more extracurricular activities.

Name: ACADEMY OF PUBLIC RELATIONS
overview: Students like our technology department which contains two laboratories, wireless carts, and SMART Boards. Press Brief offers a supportive forum for students to present in front of the school. Our emphasis on public speaking allows students to gain confidence and self-esteem. Student-centered activities include student advisory boards and shared decision-making. Class trips include Cirque du Soleil, Broadway shows, pro sports, and more. Though our school sets high expectations, the small class sizes enable small group and individualized instruction to meet the needs of our students. Our principal has an open-door policy, holds monthly luncheons with parents, and facilitates a monthly parent hot topic series. Sixth grade students are invited to a middle school orientation. We offer a GPS program for over-age students, Saturday Academy for ELLs, and Regents preparation (science and algebra). Our remedial and enrichment programs improve student achievement.

Name: HOSTOSLINCOLN ACADEMY OF SCIENCE
overview: Hostos-Lincoln Academy of Science is an early college secondary school in collaboration with Hostos Community College. Our students enter into a seven-year process beginning in the sixth grade—50% of this year's high school senior class that began in the sixth grade will graduate with an Associate's Degree from Hostos Community College and 90% will have college credit. We have an extensive middle school arts program (visual and theater) coupled with four Regents classes in the eighth grade. Our students can be found at robotics competitions, acting on the stage, or on the soccer field—we have a diverse student body.

Name: BRONX ACADEMY OF LETTERS
printedschoolname: The Urban Assembly Bronx Academy of Letters
overview: The Urban Assembly Bronx Academy of Letters was founded on a single idea: students who can express themselves clearly in writing can do better in any path they choose in life. In addition to the challenging academic work offered, we are also committed to providing learning opportunities outside of the classroom. Throughout the year, our students participate in rigorous inquiry-based high school prep curriculum, regular field trips to arts institutions, overnight trips to colleges and universities, enriching community-building activities, rigorous academic intervention services, and a comprehensive after-school program. During the Summer, our student services team connects students to programs that allow them to experience the world around them, including study abroad, internships, and summer programming. We celebrate hard work, curiosity, self-expression, and service. Our graduates are articulate, critical readers and writers, who are fully prepared to maximize their learning and growth.

Name: MS 302 LUISA DESSUS CRUZ MS
overview: As a college-preparatory middle school, Luisa Dessus Cruz, Middle School 302 is dedicated to the academic and personal development of students who will become tomorrow's leaders in the fields of mathematics, science, technology, and social service. Our curriculum develops well-rounded students who are challenged and engaged. The teachers are readying students to creatively and critically think, become self-disciplined, and develop social responsibility through high quality driven instruction. Students are challenged to question, problem-solve, communicate, and assume personal responsibility. We are an empowering and nurturing school community of diverse and collaborative members dedicated to achieving high standards for all of our students. Before our students graduate, it is expected that our students visit a minimum of 10 colleges and complete 30 hours of community service. Our students are afforded Latin percussion, modern dance, music production, visual arts, and coding. Our students participate in basketball, track and field, volleyball, flag football, cheerleading, and tennis.

Name: MS 301 PAUL L. DUNBAR MS
printedschoolname: The Paul L. Dunbar Middle School (M.S. 301)
overview: The goal for all students who attend Dunbar Middle School is to "GET BETTER EVERY DAY!" Our approach to education is identified by creativity, collaboration, and community. Students engage in problem-based learning in math, hands-on activities in our state-of-the-art science lab, presenting and justifying claims in social studies, and using the Teacher's College Writers' Workshop in ELA. Our partnership with Lincoln Center exposes our students to the arts and gives our community access to Lincoln Center, as well as to free shows at our school by world renowned performers. We partner with Children's Aid Society to offer a comprehensive approach to education for the benefit of our students and their families. We will identify the strengths and needs of each student, extend school hours to expand learning time, work with our students to become more college and career ready, and engage families in the educational experience.

Name: PSMS 004 CROTONA PARK WEST
overview: P.S./M.S. 4 is a school where scholars come first. Our vision is to create a culture of self-reflective scholars who use learning opportunities to develop a global awareness of the world. The school society, comprised of parents, guardians, students, teachers, and staff, makes a combined effort to provide an educational experience that teaches the whole child. We acknowledge students' mental, social, emotional, and physical needs. Our mission at P.S./M.S. 4 is to devise and implement a comprehensive educational program that encompasses all members of the community and actively engages them in real world experiences, technological advances, and meaningful discourse. The fundamental components consist of data analysis, goal-setting, teacher teams, reflective practitioners, authentic professional development, parental involvement, and the establishment of societal norms.

Name: MOTT HALL III
overview: Our students enjoy our small environment where they are treated like family. We celebrate our students' talents through science and curriculum fairs, talent showcases, and cultural celebrations. Students like our SMART Boards and computers in each classroom, laptop carts for each grade, and computer lab. Parents embrace our challenging academic experiences and high standards. We offer families tools to support their children, including weekly progress reports and an online gradebook. We work closely with our PTA to offer events that celebrate our community and showcase our students' talents. Our school is proud to have proficiency scores in ELA and math that nearly triple district averages. We were listed as "Among the Best" middle schools by the NY Daily News in 2012. We have been profiled in each edition of New York City's Best Public Middle Schools: A Parent's Guide. Our graduates regularly gain acceptance into highly competitive specialized, private, and parochial high schools.

Name: KAPPA
overview: The Knowledge and Power Preparatory Academy (KAPPA) is modeled after KIPP Charter School, in partnership with Replications, Inc., which was founded by John Elwell. There are currently four KAPPA schools in NYC that have been modeled after our school. KAPPA is unique in that over 90% of KAPPA scholars do not reside in the community. The vast majority of our students commute to school via public transportation. KAPPA is in its 12th year as an autonomous school and 17th year as an educational institution. Our student population is diverse. Students hail from Central America, South America, Africa, Asia, and the Caribbean. The vast majority of our students speak a second language at home, adding to the uniqueness of our school. What these diverse students have in common is that they value education, which is a direct result of strong parental support at home.

Name: IS 190
overview: We are a collaborative school community dedicated to improving our students' academic performance while fostering their physical, mental, social, and emotional growth. We provide a nurturing environment, and to address the needs of each student we offer data-driven instruction that support college and career readiness. Through continued collaboration with parents, administrators, staff, and community-based organizations, we prepare every student to meet the needs of an ever-changing society. We envision that each student values education, holds high personal and educational expectations, is accountable for his or her learning, communicates effectively, excels in all areas, connects school and real-life situations, and develops into a lifelong learner. To maintain an environment that is safe and conducive to learning, we implement the Positive Behavioral Intervention and Supports (PBIS) and The Leader in Me programs. By developing well-rounded students, we help them unleash their individual worth and potential to lead their own lives.

Name: PS 212
overview: The Multicultural Magnet School P.S./M.S. 212 is a laboratory for learning. This pre-k through grade eight school provides a rigorous, academically rich environment that is fully aligned with the Common Core Learning Standards. The P.S./M.S. 212 learning continuum includes a diverse menu of academic offerings in addition to traditional ones. Some of these courses include NYSESLAT Test preparation, Academic Intervention Services, and technology. Our new STEM lab is sure to promote 21st-century skills that will enable our students to compete at the high school level and beyond. Students at P.S./M.S. 212 are highly rewarded for demonstrating Preparation, Respect, Integrity, Discipline, and Excellence (PRIDE). Our students are invited on trips to museums, NBA games at Madison Square Garden, Broadway plays, amusement parks, and other cultural institutions as a part of our PBIS program. These incentives demonstrate our commitment to educate and support the whole child. We also partner with the CHAMPs program to offer yearlong before- and after-school sports activities. Our ultimate goal is to cultivate lifelong learners who will find their passion and pursue it with diligence.

Name: BRONX LATIN
overview: The Bronx Latin School is a college preparatory school for students in grades 6-12. We offer a rigorous program of arts and sciences and encourage serious scholarship, independent thought, and clarity of expression. We work to inspire students to achieve their personal best through collaboration, inclusion, and goal-setting in a supportive environment of high expectations. We believe every child has the right to an exemplary education. We strive to empower our students to thrive in and graduate from college and positively impact their communities. Along with the integration of technology in the classroom, our integrated curriculum engages students and connects rigorous learning in the classroom with the real world. Parents value Bronx Latin's small classes and student support services. These services include daily advisory, before- and after-school tutoring, as well as Saturday test preparation classes. Bronx Latin students all participate in Socratic seminars and exit projects. Bronx Latin also offers accelerated eighth-grade courses where qualifying students will sit for the Common Core Algebra Regents and the Living Environment or Earth Science Regents Exam at the end of their eighth-grade year.

printedschoolname: East Bronx Academy for the Future
overview: Students participate in technology-enhanced inquiry and community-focused, project-based learning. In eighth grade, they are exposed to the high school atmosphere by having the opportunity to take Regents exams and high school elective courses for credit. Parents are excited about the resources available at our school, including access to their child's grades and academic performance through our Skedula Program. Through our Kid Talk sessions, we help students achieve academic excellence.

Name: FANNIE LOU HAMER MIDDLE SCHOOL
overview: Our mission is for our students to graduate knowing how to work effectively, think critically, and act compassionately. With the emphasis on Common Core Standards, students are able to justify mathematical arguments, design experiments, study historical artifacts, and analyze literature. Laptops and SMART Board technology are used to enhance learning. We are a small school with advisories of 15, and our staff works to meet the needs of every child. Town halls celebrate school-wide events, and we provide mediations to resolve conflicts peacefully and with compassion. We provide an environment that focuses on supportive services and developing our youth into leaders. We have partnered with other organizations to provide these additional opportunities for our school community. Children's Aid Society provides daily after-school programs. Students have access to individual therapy through Astor Services for Children and Families located within the school building. In collaboration with Partnership with Children, we offer student leadership and youth development groups such as: Peer Mediators, Student Ambassadors, and Lunch Leaders. Free eye examinations and glasses are available from the Helen Keller Foundation for all students.

Name: PS/MS 031 THE WILLIAM LLOYD GARRISON
overview: Our school strives to provide students the foundation they need to be successful, lifelong learners. All staff members put time and personal attention into addressing the specific academic, social, and emotional needs of each student by using Positive Behavioral Interventions and Support (PBIS). Our school commits to helping students develop and master the academic and social skills necessary for success in the global community. All classrooms are equipped with SMART Boards and students have access to a one-to-one laptop program, as well as a state-of-the-art multimedia technology laboratory. We have a collaboration with ASPIRA who provides after-school social and academic support to our students year-round.

Name: JHS 151 LOU GEHRIG
overview: J.H.S. 151 offers unlimited possibilities and opportunities to all students as lifelong learners in a rapidly changing global, multicultural society in the 21st century. Our students are prepared for the challenges of the increasingly technological era, and they will apply their knowledge and skills beyond the walls of our school. Parents highly approve of our learning environment where students feel safe, respected, and deeply cared for, and where parents are welcomed as valuable partners in educating their children. They value our instructional program, as well as our after-school and Saturday programs. A small, diverse school community, J.H.S. 151's core work is centered on the interest of students through effective instruction that follows rigorous curricula with measurable outcomes. Collaborative effort among all constituencies and shared commitment to continuous improvement promote our students' social, physical, emotional, and intellectual development.

Team 22 works together to ensure that every student leaves our building at the end of eighth grade prepared for success in high school and beyond.

Name: P/IS 218 R HERNANDEZ DUAL LANG
printedschoolname: The Rafael Hernandez Dual Language Magnet School (P.S./I.S. 218)
overview: Students at P.S./I.S. 218 spend half of their time learning content information in English and the other half learning in Spanish. Our goal is to have students become biliterate, meaning that they can engage in academic work in both languages. Additionally, our middle school students are given accelerated instruction in mathematics and science in anticipation of taking the Algebra I and Living Environment Regents in the eighth grade. And, through a wide variety of experiences, students view the world through a global perspective. Whether communicating with college students abroad or conducting research for a company like Time Inc., our students use the skills learned in the classroom in authentic ways. Students thrive in an environment that enables them to be productive citizens who respect and embrace linguistic and cultural differences. Parents enjoy a welcoming environment which encourages them to participate in the education of their children. They embrace the high expectations of our teachers, and work alongside us to foster well-rounded young adults. The school also encourages parents' personal growth by providing workshops on current topics.

Name: BRONX WRITING ACADEMY
overview: Students graduating from the Bronx Writing Academy (BWA) are problem solvers and effective communicators who can articulately express their ideas in writing. Every adult at the BWA is here to support the students in their academic and personal growth. Our school day goes from 8:20am-2:40pm with the opportunity to opt in to a variety of after-school activities such as LeAp, Robotics, Book Clubs, Coding, and more! At the Bronx Writing Academy, we believe that learning should be personalized and thus we have a one-to-one laptop to student ratio. Students complete daily work online, with all teachers creating personal websites with links to personalized student work.

Name: URBAN SCIENCE ACADEMY
overview: The Urban Science Academy—as our name makes clear—is a science academy. Our students engage in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) through multiple pathways, and enjoy opportunities to engage in hands-on learning. We understand that the jobs of the future will require minds trained in the ways of the sciences. We work with a large number of organizations: Urban Advantage/American Museum of Natural History; the Lego Mindstorm robotics program; Plaza Construction and Salvadori for real life engineering experiences; the NYC Solar Schools Program; Genetics with Cornell University; and NASA's Cubes in Space. All these projects are joined in our 21st Century After-School Program under the umbrella of the Urban Science Maker Space, where students also engage in 3-D printing, coding activities, and select individual paths to learning and creating. In our other classes, students benefit from engaging instruction and exciting extracurricular activities. Class sizes are kept as small as possible, and our school's culture emphasizes student responsibility and healthy development. We have an active Student Council, and a Peer Group Connection program that attaches eighth grade leaders to mentor our sixth graders.

Name: COMPREHENSIVE MODEL SCHOOL PROJECT MS 327
overview: At the Comprehensive Model School Project (CMSP), children are our first priority. Therefore, we are an inclusive community comprised of students, parents, and educators dedicated to high academic achievement and the complete social-emotional development of each student. We are a community that respects and honors diversity. Students are valued members of our school community who understand the importance of self-respect and respect for others. The academic success of our students is a collaborative effort and is the result of our staff's expertise, planning, professionalism, extensive parent involvement, students' commitment to success, and an atmosphere of social equity in our school.

Name: BRONX SCHOOL FOR LAW GOVERNMENT AND JUSTICE
printedschoolname: Bronx School for Law, Government and Justice
overview: The Bronx School for Law, Government and Justice (LGJ) is an educational community that believes learning is a product of thinking. Students at LGJ are engaged in hands-on, minds-on learning in their core classes as well as through the law curriculum, mentoring, and extracurricular activities. Both students and parents like that when you come to LGJ you become a part of a family. Our families appreciate the many partnerships that create opportunities for mentoring, internships, and shadow days for our students. The LGJ middle school is small and allows for students and parents to receive one-on-one attention. We were founded in September 1997 by the Urban Assembly, and share a campus with the Bronx Criminal Court Complex.

Name: THEATRE ARTS PRODUCTION COMPANY SCHOOL
overview: TAPCo is one of the first public STEAM (science, technology, engineering, arts, math) schools in NYC. We provide a strong academic program and the opportunity for students to explore all of the arts. In high school, students can study dance, drama, or visual studies. Students and parents appreciate our family-like atmosphere, our many different activities, and our strong, supportive staff. TAPCo has two dance studios, a black box theater, a full-sized auditorium, a theater-scene shop, a video production studio, two chorus rooms, and an art room. We partner with the 92nd St. YMCA and Lincoln Center. Our college acceptance rate is 99% with over $1.5 million in student scholarships and grants. We communicate with families through our school website, morning announcements, student meetings with their staff agents, town hall meetings, an open-door policy for the administration, and our parent association. TAPCo was cited as a hidden gem in New York City's Best Public Middle Schools: A Parent's Guide.

Name: THE BRONX SCHOOL OF SCIENCE INQUIRY AND INVESTIG
printedschoolname: The Bronx School of Young Leaders
overview: We offer an academically challenging curriculum that prepares students for high school and beyond. Many of our students have been accepted to prestigious programs, such as TEAK Fellowships. We offer a transitional bilingual program for students who are new to the country (zero to three years in the country). We also offer specific tutoring for students with individual needs. At the Bronx School of Young Leaders our mission is to "enjoy and improve the world". There are many special programs aligned to our mission at the school. Students work hard to be Super Scholars and attend special trips when they qualify by having 85% or higher in all of their classes. We have a wonderful attendance rate, higher than the city average, and we take students with perfect attendance on special field trips. So many extracurricular opportunities are available including: dance, music, visual arts, basketball, baseball, soccer, computer science, sign language, spoken word, chess, documentary film, and volleyball. We offer several programs on Saturdays through our CBO, Fordham University. Parents attend classes in English as a New Language and fitness. We are a community school and we always welcome the ideas of parents, students, and community members.

Name: MS 390
overview: At Middle School 390, we offer a variety of exciting and engaging extracurricular activities which keep our students interested in school. Our school culture emphasizes student social-emotional development empowering students make positive decisions independently. We foster strong relationships with our families while maintaining consistent communication about our students' progress. Each class is 100% equipped with high quality technology (one-to-one iPads and laptops). We are part of the Middle School Quality Initiative and Learning Partners Program. In addition, we offer dual language and transitional bilingual programs in English and Spanish, as well as an Honors/Regents Program Track designed to provide students with the opportunity to participate in Regents courses in the eighth grade (Algebra, US History, and Living Environment). Thus, maximizing opportunities for college and career readiness. Our ideal students will be committed to engage in a rigorous curriculum and participate in our high school and college prep programs.

Name: MS 391
overview: Students value the sense of family at our school. They know that every member of the school community is there to ensure that they are putting their best foot forward. Our students are taught the importance of striving for excellence in completing projects. We celebrate our students' accomplishments and provide them the opportunity to shine by sharing their success with their families and peers. Students use the RAMS Way (Respect, Accountability, Maturity, and Success) to promote their growth and development as learners and leaders. Our motto of college, career, and character drives our school. Our open-door policy helps parents feel welcome, and our staff is accessible and available for conferences. Parents can monitor their child's academic progress through the use of our online grading system, PupilPath. Students enjoy a wide range of field trips, including Herkimer Diamond Mines, Medieval Times, museums, and Broadway shows. Technology is integrated into content areas to support learning. We have instrumental music, visual arts, yoga, capoeira, and other enrichment activities for our students. We also have a chess club and morning gym program.

Name: EAGLE ACADEMY FOR YOUNG MEN
printedschoolname: The Eagle Academy for Young Men
overview: The mission of the Eagle Academy for Young Men is to develop young men committed to the pursuit of academic excellence, strong character, and responsible leadership. We are a college-preparatory school focused and committed to the school's guiding principles of academic excellence, mentoring, leadership, integrity, character development, and community service. We are part of a network of six all-male schools across the New York City area which work in collaboration to support the needs of our community and our young men. Our scholars are provided rigorous academic opportunities, offering Regents courses in the middle school and intensive reading interventions though the Middle School Quality Initiative. We partner with parents to educate the whole child, and provide regular community-based parent workshops open to all families. We prepare our students to join the ranks of future leaders in society. Our scholars are expected to conduct themselves professionally, wear uniforms, and participate in cultural rituals as part of their normal school routines. Successful male professionals from a wide array of careers act as mentors to provide scholarship and internship opportunities.

Name: JHS 118 WILLIAM W NILES
printedschoolname: William W. Niles (M.S. 118) Pace, Spectrum & Excellence
overview: The William W. Niles School, M.S. 118 has three academies: PACE—an accelerated program for gifted and talented students; Spectrum—an accelerated program for honors students; and Excellence—serving all students from the school zone and offering a general educational program with academic enrichment opportunities. This design allows staff and students to benefit from the advantages of smaller learning communities inside a larger school. As a large school, we are able to offer more types of arts electives, enrichment, and major partnerships that support college- and career-readiness. Because we have smaller academies, we are able to offer a personalized experience for all students with smaller teacher teams, an advisory program, a variety of celebrations and parent engagement activities, and dedicated teachers and counselors who know and connect with their students. Our high school guidance and preparation are outstanding: 9 out of 10 of all students are on track to graduate after 9th grade, and 24% of PACE's graduates were admitted to a specialized high school in 2017. Our active PA and School Leadership Team help us to grow and improve. Our 2017 Quality Review recognized our excellent school culture and high expectations.

Name: JONAS BRONCK ACADEMY
overview: At Jonas Bronck Academy (JBA), our students become scholars and their families become part of our larger JBA family. We create an environment where scholars challenge, question, and learn to think critically. We nurture the safe haven where scholars feel secure, supported, and understand the importance of community. JBA is a school where we model respect, integrity, and dignity for everyone so that the children we serve have professional role models. Parents and guardians are our partners and their presence in our school and their support at home are critical and essential to each scholar’s success. We work to prepare scholars to live the future of their dreams. JBA is the opportunity of a lifetime.

Name: I.S. 254
overview: Students enjoy our family-like atmosphere and small classroom setting. Teachers are readily accessible to students before, during, and after school. Our school features a variety of academic and recreational programs, including after-school varsity sports and arts programs. Parents enjoy having access to teachers, guidance counselors, administrators, and school staff. Parents are invited to school events to learn about their child's academic, social, and emotional progress. Our school conducts special outreach to parents of students with a variety of learning needs. Beyond the required academic courses, students participate in a variety of extracurricular classes such as career development and sports. Our school also collaborates with a number of community organizations such as Fordham University, Manhattan College, Bronx Community College, Lehman College, and Bronx Institute (GEARUP). Unique education programs at TEAM 254: STEM Lab, two state-of-the-art science labs, one business-like Mac lab, Middle School Quality Initiative, Facing History, drama/theater program, Arts in the Middle, Lincoln Center, and Arthur Miller Partner. Regents offered in Algebra and Living Environment. CBO program—Community Association of Progressive Dominicans

Name: PS 129 TWIN PARKS UPPER
printedschoolname: The Academy for Independent Learning and Leadership (P.S./M.S. 129)
overview: M.S. 129 functions like a family unit. Students and teachers respect one another. We are proud to be members of the M.S. 129 campus! Our programs are exciting and allow students to take on the challenges of the Common Core. Some of our programs include: Fountas and Pinnell Guided Reading, Rosetta Stone and Achieve 3000 technology program for our English as a New Language students, READY test preparation, Code X, CMP3 math, and GoMath. Parents are grateful for the principal's open-door policy and the structured disciplinary environment that includes a uniform policy and our high academic expectations. Our goal is to promote independent learning and leadership to all of our students. It is essential that our children understand the value of education. It is our job at M.S. 129 to teach our students to value themselves and to help them realize their full potential. They must push themselves to achieve high marks and to be self-directed leaders if they are to succeed in the future.

Name: PS 211
overview: Since our doors opened in 1969, generations of students, including some of our current teachers, have grown and developed in our classrooms. As we serve pre-k to eighth grade, a majority of our students stay in the school for over nine years. We offer a wide curriculum alongside an extensive Sports Program and an Arts Program that includes Encores!, a program at New York City Center which has affiliations with various museums in New York City (including The Mount Vernon Hotel Museum & Garden) as well as out of state (Plimoth Plantation in Massachusetts). Additionally, we have a strong partnership with the New York Botanical Garden and with the NY Common Pantry Healthy Eating Program. The Healthy Eating Program provides nutritional lessons for students in all grades as well as a parent workshop that involves our school community vegetable. We are a bilingual school committed to providing high-quality education to all students by meeting their emotional, social, and educational needs. We are also proud of our association with the Children's Aid Society, which enhances our services by providing after-school and holiday programs, and other community building activities.

Name: PS 214
overview: At P.S. 214, we help students succeed by offering a challenging curriculum based on student interests and a distinctive school culture based on high expectations. Students' character development is fostered through a solid advisory program, a peer mediation program, an active student action committee, and rich service learning opportunities. Through the Skedula online program and quarterly progress reports, we strive to keep parents up-to-date with students' progress. P.S. 214 was one of the proud winners of a Campaign for Middle School Success improvement grant. Eighth graders have the opportunity to enjoy a full day filled with entertainment at the Great Adventures Amusement Park as part of senior activities. We received the distinction as one of the top five most improved mathematics schools in the Bronx by the Daily News (June 3, 2009), and were recognized by the NYC Department of Education as a model school for creating a pipeline and training site for NYC teacher apprentices.

Name: FREDERICK DOUGLASS ACADEMY V MIDDLE SCHOOL
overview: Frederick Douglass Academy V nurtures and supports the growth of caring and compassionate critical thinkers through arts-infused, authentic learning. Our students graduate academically and socially minded, ready for success at the high school and college of their choice and capable of meeting the demands of the 21st century. Our mission is to support each scholar in becoming socially minded and academically focused young adults, capable to succeed in the high school, college, and career of their choice through the 4 C's critical to success in the 21st century: Compassion, Collaboration, Communication, and Creative Critical thinking.

Name: KAPPA III
printedschoolname: Knowledge and Power Preparatory Academy III
overview: Knowledge and Power Preparatory Academy III (KAPPA III) creates and sustains a college-going culture to ensure all students have the knowledge of a post-secondary education. Students participate in an elective course, College & Career Readiness, to cultivate a culture of high expectations. Students attend college trips and participate in Career Day. Each morning students begin their day reciting a chant. The chants provide a sense of pride and teach students to be responsible, internalize values, and help them develop capacity for self-motivation and self-discipline. KAPPA III uses EMT Machine and ECard system as a school-wide Positive Behavior Intervention & Support system to establish a climate in which appropriate behavior is the norm. Students earn points throughout the week and redeem the points at the KAPPA III store for prizes. Students participate in Multicultural Day, which provides an opportunity for them to learn about different cultures. Every Friday students receive advisory lessons to establish and maintain a climate of positivity and acceptance towards themselves and others. Students participate in team-building activities to enhance problem-solving skills, develop trust, and improve teamwork.

overview: I.S. 318 is designed to help students excel in math, science, and technology through the arts in order to meet the demands of an ever-changing world. We nurture, support, guide, and enhance students’ learning while preparing them to adapt to meet the demands of any fast-paced career. We provide a wide range of instructional programs, including blended instruction. We are a technology-based school with SMART Boards in every classroom and laptops in every classroom. In partnership with our community-based organization, Children's Aid Society, we offer an advisory program to support students' social-emotional growth embedded into the school day and a free after-school program five days per week.

Name: ACCION ACADEMY
overview: At ACCION Academy, we have a unique opportunity to provide an individualized, warm, and caring environment for our students because our school is just the right size. Serving an average of only 135 students per year, ACCION is less than one-third the size of the average middle school in New York. This means that our compassionate veteran teachers can form meaningful relationships with students and parents on the journey towards success. We can give each child our full attention to ensure they receive whatever services, programs, or activities they need to grow. ACCION stands for "Achievement, Community, Consciousness, Integrity, Opportunity Now!" Our family-oriented school community fosters the highest levels of achievement, mentoring, and service. The student government helps to influence our school's decisions. The CBO we work with is the PHIPPS program. They provide enrichment and recreational activities to promote student autonomy and hands on activity to through role play and problem solving during the after-school program. Furthermore, there are variety of activities including a robotics team, comic book illustration intramural sports, drama, dance, and much more.

Name: IS 206 ANN MERSEREAU
overview: M.S. 206 is a small middle school with its own building. Each child is known and supported by every adult in the building. Class sizes are small and the staff supports academic growth and positive behaviors for each student. Academic support services include additional small group instruction in ELA and math provided by classroom teachers three times per week, a pull-out, small group reading program, and an additional class, which focuses solely on vocabulary development. M.S. 206 is a true middle school with theater arts, vocal music, health classes, and strong physical education and competitive athletics programs to round out an emphasis on the core subjects. The school also partners with Good Shepherd Services to run an extended school-day program. Students in the program have a meal at 2:35pm and then participate in athletics, the arts, leadership, and academics until 5:30pm.
